A clearinghouse for media, petitions, and other events related to organizing against injustice at Indiana University Bloomington.

IUB Organizing Hub

Undermining Faculty Governance at IUI (formerly IUPUI)

Using the breakup of IUPUI as justification, Pamela Whitten and IU's administration undermine tenure at the institution, putting dozens of professors at risk.

Articles

  • ‘Still in the dark’: IUPUI split causes faculty departures, difficulties for students [The Herald Times]
  • IUPUI Faculty Council says President Whitten and Board of Trustees ‘undermine’ shared governance [Indiana Public Media]
  • Hard Choices Amid Purdue-Indiana Split [Inside Higher Ed]
  • A Messy Divorce: The Dissolution of Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis poses a novel risk to tenure [Chronicle of Higher Education]

Related

  • Under Attack: Tenure and Academic Freedom (Whitten undermines tenure in Georgia) [Counterpunch]
  • University System of Georgia Eviscerates Tenure [AAUP]
  • Academic Freedom and Tenure: University System of Georgia [AAUP]

iub-organizing-collective

This site acts as a hub for news, media, petitions, and events around injustice on the campus of Indiana University Bloomington (IUB). This site is collectively managed by the Indiana University Bloomington Organizing Collective (IUB-OC), a loosely affiliated group composed of faculty, graduate students, undergraduates, and alumni from IUB.
